responses.rationale: The segment describes a potential future risk to exports, not factual reporting of current economic metrics using standard verbs.
The segment reports the number of human cases, not economic metrics.
The segment reports the number of affected herds, not economic metrics.
The segment describes the historical circulation and recent jump of the virus.
The segment describes limitations of a study.
The segment reports on disclosure forms and conflicts of interest.
The segment reports where a paper was published.
The segment reports scientific findings about virus infectivity.
The segment reports scientific findings about testing results.
The segment describes transmission methods.
The segment reports the location and size of an outbreak.
The segment lists locations of outbreaks.
The segment reports the number of infected people and their symptoms.
The segment reports the first case of transmission to humans.
The segment describes the severity of a past pandemic.
The segment describes a past pandemic and WHO declaration.
The segment describes expected exposure during migration.
The segment reports finding a dead condor and testing results.
The segment reports that most states have reported cases.
The segment reports the number of confirmed cases.
The segment reports the location of an outbreak and farm details.
The segment describes how the virus is carried.
The segment reports the number of affected birds and locations.
The segment describes a company.
Reports production volume 'raises around 30 million pounds of turkey a year' using standard factual language.
Reports state ranking 'No. 1 turkey producing state' which is factual economic/production data.
